main event: A woman in Peoria, Illinois reported seeing a bright, elongated yellow light moving swiftly over her house for a brief moment on October 11, 1966.
interesting points: The object was approximately 3 feet long and a few inches thick, based on the witness's estimate from the ground.
The object moved very fast and passed over the witness's house in about 2 seconds.
There was no sound associated with the object.
The witness was prompted to report the sighting after reading an article in Life magazine requesting people to report UFO sightings.
The Air Force classified the object as a 'meteor' in their Project Blue Book investigation.
witnesses: a single civilian witness, a woman
photographs: no photographs were included in the report
